title: Leicester City stars face huge pay cuts if they are relegated from the Premier League this season
text:
Leicester City stars face huge pay cuts if they are relegated from the Premier League this season The champions are only one point away from the relegation zone following a nightmare title defence Share Leicester's title defence has gone horribly wrong (Photo: Rex Features) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
As Leicester City's title defence continues to go from bad to worse, members of Claudio Ranieri's squad face huge pay cuts if the Foxes are relegated. 
Sunday's 3-0 loss to Manchester United saw the champions drop to 16th place in the Premier League table, just one point clear of the drop zone. 
It marks a stalk contrast from last season's fairytale campaign which saw the 5,000-1 outsiders stun the footballing world by romping to the Premier League title. 
And now, Mirror Sport understands most of Leicesterâ€™s stars who penned big new deals last summer do have relegation clauses in them, which will see their salaries slashed. Vardy signed a new deal in the summer... (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) ... as did Kasper Schmeichel (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Leicester stars fear Ranieri is tinkering too much - after CHICKEN BURGER aex 
This comes after the club moved to mitigate the threat of relegation by inserting the clauses that are thought to see as much as a 40 per cent pay cut into the new deals signed by their exiting players in the summer, plus the new faces brought in by Ranieri over the summer. 
A raft of players were handed new contracts following their title success, including Jamie Vardy, Riyad Mahrez, Wes Morgan, Danny Simpson, Danny Drinkwater and Kasper Schmeichel, as well as manager Ranieri. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
